March 24, 1952
Mr. Graydon Ausmus
WUOA, University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Graydon:
I have your note of March 22nd concerning the NUEA. Dallas
has to be in Columbus anyway so I feel certain he would be
available if you need him.
Since you are chairing the luncheon meeting, it would seem to
me that you ought to introduce both Commissioner Walker and
Mr. Fletcher, whose letter of March 18th indicates that he will
be glad to talk to NAEB on Friday, April 18th. He, however, indi¬
cates that he is still awating the letter of invitation from
Graydon Ausmus which I told him vrould be forthcoming. He ends
his letter with the followings
There are many major problems which must be
met head-on with the hope that satisfactory
solutions can be found before the summer.
I do not think it necessary for you to limit either one of the
speakers. What both say will be of sufficient newsworthy attention
so that the crowd will hold up any future programming until the
luncheon is over.
It would seem to me that with these headliners you should be able
to charge sufficient for luncheon tickets to bring in even a greater
profit than you showed last year. I know that A1 Gaines will do a
wonderful job of promoting the sale of tickets. It might not b« a
bad idea to have him prepare a thousand invitations calling attention
to the luncheon and mail those to the registrars at the Institute on
Thursday, April 17th.
With best wishes.
.ially yours.
